subject: VPN Connection Issue - Samsung Phone
body: Hi, I'm unable to connect to the VPN from my Samsung Galaxy phone. Getting authentication failed error. This is urgent as I need to access internal systems for a critical task. Please help ASAP.

suggested_actions: Verify user credentials and authentication method
Reset and reconfigure the VPN profile on the Samsung device
Ensure device date and time are correct
Confirm VPN client app is up to date and compatible
Check network connectivity and firewall settings
Escalate to Network/VPN team if issue persists

assistant_reply:
**Ticket:** VPN Connection Issue – Samsung Galaxy Phone  
**Priority:** High (critical task)  

Below is a step‑by‑step troubleshooting guide you can follow right now. If any step does not resolve the problem, let me know the result (including screenshots or exact error messages) and we’ll move to the next level of support.

---

## 1️⃣ Verify the Basics

| Item | What to Check | How to Check |
|------|---------------|--------------|
| **Internet connectivity** | Can you browse the web (e.g., https://www.google.com) on the same network? | Open Chrome/Browser and load any external site. |
| **Date & Time** | Must be exact (including time‑zone). A drift of >5 min will break most VPN auth. | Settings → General management → Date & time → **Enable “Automatic date & time”** (or set manually to the correct time). |
| **VPN credentials** | Username / password are correct and not expired. | Try logging into the corporate web portal (or any other service that uses the same credentials). |
| **Account lockout** | After several failed attempts the account may be locked. | If you get a “account locked” message on the portal, request an unlock from AD/Identity team. |
